message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to show you this amazing product. I think it's worth a lot to you, and I'm willing to make a great offer. I'm thinking of selling it to you for $200.
I'm interested in the product, but $200 is a bit too high for me. I'm willing to pay $120 for it.

I understand that $200 might be a bit steep, but I still think the product is worth a premium. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer it to you for $180. It's a great deal, and I think you'll really enjoy the product.
I appreciate the willingness to meet me halfway, but $180 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to pay $150 for it.

I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we're getting close to the minimum price I was willing to accept. However, I'm willing to make one more concession. I'll offer it to you for $160. This is as low as I'm willing to go, so I hope you'll consider it.
I understand that you're getting close to your minimum price, but I'm still not comfortable with $160. I'm willing to pay $140 for it.
I'm really close to my minimum price, but I'm still not willing to go any lower. I'll make one more offer: I'll sell it to you for $155. This is my final offer, so I hope you'll consider it.
I understand that you're making your final offer, but I'm still not comfortable with $155. I'm willing to pay $145 for it.
I'm really disappointed that we're not able to come to an agreement at this point. I've already gone as low as I can, and I'm not willing to go any lower. I think it's time for us to part ways.
I understand that you're not willing to go any lower, but I'm still not comfortable with $150. I'm willing to pay $130 for it.
